orchestrator.orchestrator module

class orchestrator.orchestrator.CheckToken(empty_response_cls, grpc_status_code=grpc.StatusCode.UNAUTHENTICATED, grpc_details='')[source]

Bases: object

Decorator that parses the gRPC headers to fetch the acces token (either the static access token or the JWT token). Thereafter, it verifies whether the access token is valid or not. If it is valid, it sets the userid and the role (after fetching it from the datastore) in the gRPC context. If the access token verification fails, it raises an UNAUTHENTICATED status code.

class orchestrator.orchestrator.LeotestOrchestrator(grpc_hostname='localhost', grpc_port=50051, admin_access_token='', jwt_secret='', jwt_algo='', grpc_max_workers=10, db_server='localhost', db_port=27017, db_name='leotest')[source]

Bases: object

Wrapper class that bootstraps the gRPC service of the LEOScope’s orchestartor.

start()[source]

Wrapper around LeotestOrchestrator.start_grpc_service()

start_grpc_service()[source]

Bootsraps the gRPC service of the orchestartor.

class orchestrator.orchestrator.LeotestOrchestratorGrpc(db_server='localhost', db_port=27017, db_name='leotest', admin_access_token='leotest-access-token', jwt_secret='', jwt_algo='')[source]

Bases: LeotestOrchestrator

Implementation of the gRPC service exposed by the orchestrator. The class implements all the rpc’s defined in the common/leotest.proto protocol definition. Incoming rpc requests are verified by CheckToken before being invoked.

Parameters:

  • db_server (str, optional) – Hostname of the MongoDB database server, defaults to ‘localhost’

  • db_port (int, optional) – Port number of the MongoDB database server, defaults to 27017

  • db_name (str, optional) – Name of the database, defaults to ‘leotest’

  • admin_access_token (str, optional) – Static access token to use to initialize the admin username, defaults to ‘leotest-access-token’

  • jwt_secret (str, optional) – JWT secret to use for authenticating the gRPC requests, defaults to ‘’

  • jwt_algo (str, optional) – JWT algorithm to use for authenticating the gRPC requests, defaults to ‘’

delete_job_by_id(request, context)[source]

Delete a given job using jobid. Only users with role ADMIN and the user who owns the job can delete a job.

Parameters:

  • request (pb2.message_delete_job_by_id) – gRPC request message for delete_job_by_id

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

If the job with the given jobid exists, the job is deleted and exists is set to True. If the job does not exist, exists is set to False. In all cases, message contains the detailed message about the result of the request.

Return type:

pb2.message_delete_job_by_id_response

delete_jobs_by_nodeid(request, context)[source]

Delete all jobs on a given nodeid. Only users with role ADMIN can delete all jobs on a node.

Parameters:

  • request (pb2.delete_jobs_by_nodeid) – gRPC request message for delete_jobs_by_nodeid

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

num_deleted contains the number of jobs deleted. message contains a message with detailed information about the status of the request.

Return type:

pb2.message_delete_job_by_id_response

Parameters:

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

If the request is successful, state is set to 0, otherwise it is set to 1. In both cases, message contains details about the status of the request.

Return type:

pb2.message_delete_node_response

get_jobs_by_nodeid(request, context)[source]

Get jobs scheduled on a given node.

Parameters:

  • request (pb2.message_get_jobs_by_nodeid) – gRPC request message for get_jobs_by_nodeid

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

If the node with the given nodeid exists, exists is set to True and jobs contains the list of all jobs scheduled on the node. If the node does not exist, exists is set to False.

Return type:

pb2.message_get_jobs_by_nodeid_response

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

If the user with the given userid exists, exists is set to True and jobs contains the list of all jobs scheduled by the user. If the user does not exist, exists is set to False. In both cases message contains detailed information about the result.

Return type:

pb2.message_get_jobs_by_userid_response

get_nodes(request, context)[source]

Get a list of nodes after filtering them on certain parameters. All parameters are optional. When multiple parameters are specified, a combination of them is used to filter the nodes. The supported parameters are: nodeid, location, name, provider, active, activeThres.

Parameters:

  • request (pb2.message_get_nodes) – gRPC request message for get_nodes

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

nodes contains a list of all the filtered nodes.

Return type:

pb2.message_get_nodes_response

get_runs(request, context)[source]

Get a list of runs after filtering them on certain parameters. The list of paramaters currently accepted are: runid, jobid, nodeid, userid, time_range, limit.

All the parameters are optional. Client can specify one or more of the parameters. If more than one parameters are provided, then a combination of them is used to filter the runs.

Parameters:

  • request (pb2.message_get_runs) – gRPC request message for get_runs

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

If the request is successful, runs contains the list of all runs.

Return type:

pb2.message_get_runs_response

Todo

Allow only users with role NODE to be able to update run status.

get_scavenger_status(request, context)[source]

Get scavenger status (whether Active or Inactive) for a node. Only a user with role ADMIN and the user with userid==nodeid are allowed to invoke the rpc.

Parameters:

  • request (pb2.message_get_scavenger_status) – gRPC request message for get_scavenger_status

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

Tf the node is found, found is set to True and scavenger_mode_active is set to the status of the scavenger mode of the node. If scavenger mode is active, scavenger_mode_active=True, otherwise scavenger_mode_active=False. If the node is not found, found=False and scavenger_mode_active is undefined.

Return type:

pb2.message_get_scavenger_status_response

get_scheduled_runs(request, context)[source]

Get a list of runs scheduled in a specific time range in future. This rpc returns a list of runs (or events) in the format that can be used with the react’s fullCalender API. As such, it helps to populate the calender in the web UI for a better visualization of available time slots for job scheduling.

Parameters:

  • request (pb2.message_get_scheduled_runs) – gRPC request message for get_scheduled_runs

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

If the request is successful, state is set to 0, otherwise it is set to 1. In both cases, message contains details about the status of the request. When the request is successful, events caontains the list of all the events in the specified time range.

Return type:

pb2.message_get_scheduled_runs_response

get_tasks(request, context)[source]

Get tasks after filtering them on certain parameters. The parameters that can be specified are: taskid, runid, jobid, nodeid. All parameters are optional.

Parameters:

  • request (pb2.message_get_tasks) – gRPC request message for get_tasks

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

If the request is successful, tasks contains the lists of tasks

Return type:

pb2.message_get_tasks_response

Todo

Allow only users with role NODE to be able to get tasks.

get_user(request, context)[source]

Get a user with a given userid.

Parameters:

  • request (pb2.message_get_user) – gRPC request message for get_user

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

If the user with the given userid exists, exists is set to True and the message contains user information such as userid, name, role, team.

Return type:

pb2.message_get_user_response

kernel_access(request, context)[source]

Verify whether a userid has access to kernel services. This rpc is invoked by the kernel service running on the nodes to verify if the user who scheduled the job has privileges to modify/reconfigure kernel configuration. Usually users with roles USER_PRIV, NODE_PRIV, and ADMIN have access to kernel service. Only users with roles NODE and ADMIN hare allowed to invoke the rpc.

Parameters:

  • request (pb2.message_kernel_access) – gRPC request message for kernel_access

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

If the request is successful, state is set to 0, otherwise it is set to 1. In both cases, message contains details about the status of the request.

Return type:

pb2.message_kernel_access_response

register_user(request, context)[source]

Register a user on LEOScope. Only users with ADMIN role can register a user.

Parameters:

  • request (pb2.message_register_user) – gRPC request message for register_user

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

Returns a response message consisting of state and message. state is set to 0 if the request has succeeded, else 1. message contains the detailed message in all cases.

Return type:

pb2.message_register_user_response

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

received is set to True if successful else False

Return type:

pb2.message_heartbeat_response

reschedule_job_nearest(request, context)[source]

Reschedule a job to the nearest empty slot. The rpc receives a jobid and a start_time and an end_time and searchers for the nearest empty slot that is large enough for the job to “fit”, that is, the time length of the free slot is greater than or equal to the job length.

Parameters:

  • request (pb2.message_reschedule_job) – gRPC request message for reschedule_job_nearest

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

If the job has been rescheduled, rescheduled is set to 0 else it is set to 1. In both cases message contains detailed information about the result.

Return type:

pb2.message_reschedule_job_response

schedule_job(request, context)[source]
Schedule on a job LEOScope. The RPC call has the following flow:

  • Verify if there a conflict with the existing jobs on the nodeid.

  • If server is specified, verify if there is a conflict with

    existing jobs on server.

  • If trigger is specified, verify the trigger syntax.

  • If all is good, write the job schedule to the database.

Parameters:

  • request (pb2.message_schedule_job) – gRPC request message for schedule_job

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

If the job is scheduled successfully, state is set to 0 else it is set to 1. In both cases message contains detailed information about the result.

Return type:

pb2.message_schedule_job_response

schedule_task(request, context)[source]

Schedule a task on a node. This rpc is not to be exposed to the user and is only used internally by the testbed. An example scenario is setting up a server for jobs that require a receiver that is located on another node that is a part of the testbed. In such a scenario, the client node schedules a task on the node with nodeid==job.server and polls it to check if the server has been deployed or not.

Parameters:

  • request (pb2.message_schedule_task) – gRPC request message for schedule_task

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

Tf the node is found, found is set to True and scavenger_mode_active is set to the status of the scavenger mode of the node. If scavenger mode is active, scavenger_mode_active=True, otherwise scavenger_mode_active=False. If the node is not found, found=False and scavenger_mode_active is undefined

Return type:

pb2.message_schedule_task_response

Todo

Allow only users with role NODE to be able to schedule tasks.

set_scavenger_status(request, context)[source]

Set scavenger status (whether True or Fasle) for a node. Only a user with role ADMIN and the user with userid==nodeid are allowed to invoke the rpc.

Parameters:

  • request (pb2.message_set_scavenger_status) – gRPC request message for set_scavenger_status

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

If the request is successful, state is set to 0, otherwise it is set to 1. In both cases, message contains details about the status of the request.

Return type:

pb2.message_set_scavenger_status_response

update_global_config(request, context)[source]

Update global configuration for the testbed. Only users with an ADMIN role can invoke the RPC. For users having roles other than ADMIN, the config is not updated and the state is set to 1 in the response message.

Parameters:

  • request (pb2.message_update_global_config) – gRPC request message for update_global_config

  • context (Refer to gRPC documentation) – gRPC context

Returns:

Response indicating response state and a detailed message. state==0 implies that the request is successful. state==1 implies that there was some error encountered while processing the request. message field contains a detailed message in all cases.

Return type:

pb2.message_update_global_config_response

Parameters:

verify_jwt(jwt_access_token)[source]

Given JWT access token, verify the token and get userid, role

Parameters:

jwt_access_token (str) – JWT access token

Returns:

Returns userid and user role

Return type:

(str, LeotestUserRoles)

verify_user(userid, access_token)[source]

Given userid and access_token verify and return the user role.

Parameters:

  • userid (str) – Userid

  • access_token (str) – The access token, either static access token or JWT access token

Returns:

If the access token is valid, return the user role, else None

Return type:

int or None
